content: this pattern is inspired from my favorite stay-on baby booties the ones my great aunt-in-law colette knitted for my daughter when she was born and the ones i ve knitted for every baby in the family since then the main fabric is in garter stitch for its squishiness with a high ribbed leg and a crocheted tie to keep the booties on baby s feet they are worked from the bottom up starting with the sole it s also the perfect match to use the remaining yarn of every baby newborn sweater if you prefer to work it seamlessly it s doable there s a recipe at the end of the pattern one pattern on the go version pattern on one page only without pictures is provided as a separated file **size ** onesize newborn - 1 month sole is 9 cm x 3 cm **yarn ** fingering yarn 400 m / 100 g approx of 80 m of mc and of 20 m of cc shown in fonty moustache 50% merino 30% mohair 20% silk 225 meters / 50 grams **needles ** 2 5 mm straight needles + 1 short 23 cm or dpns an additional 2 25 mm or 2 mm straight or circular needle to pick up stitches easily for the pleat folding **gauge ** 15 sts x 32 row for 5 cm in garter stitch with 2 5 mm needles **notions ** tapestry needle 4 markers + 1 removable marker if necessary 3 mm crochet hook **level ** advanced beginner / intermediate knitter thank you to my bunch of testers christine07 / raphaelle74 / chocolatekate / clairesoleil / valeriecorner & domguyane
